azureLogAnalytics.query:
customMetrics
| where name == "EdgeMetrics-UsedMemoryBytes"
| extend dimensions=parse_json(customDimensions)
| extend device = tostring(dimensions.edge_device)
| where device == '$EdgeDeviceName'
| extend module = tostring(dimensions.module_name)
| where not (module has_any("host", "MetricsCollectorModule", "edgeAgent","edgeHub","CASBACnetRPC","MenderRestart"))
| summarize by module = replace_regex(module,'-([A-Za-z0-9]*)ConnectorModule$','')
| order by module asc

panels.description: Host uptime refers to the time during which Host OS is operational, whereas IoTEdge Daemon uptime refers to the time during which Edge runtime is operational.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.title: Device Usage

panels.description: CPU usage of each edge module deployed on a device
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Memory usage of each edge module deployed on a device
panels.title: Memory Usage

azureResourceGraph.query:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.insights/components' and name == "$AppInsightsInstance"
| project appInsightsName = name, subscriptionId, aiResourceGroup = resourceGroup
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
        | where subscriptionName startswith "dev" or subscriptionName startswith "prd"
        | distinct subscriptionId, subscriptionName, appInsightsName, aiResourceGroup
| project aiResourceGroup

resources
| where type == 'microsoft.insights/components' and name == "$AppInsightsInstance"
| project appInsightsName = name, subscriptionId
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
        | where subscriptionName startswith "dev" or subscriptionName startswith "prd"
        | distinct subscriptionId, subscriptionName, appInsightsName
| project subscriptionId

resources
| where type == 'microsoft.insights/components' and name == "$AppInsightsInstance"
| project appInsightsName = name, subscriptionId, location
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
        | where subscriptionName startswith "dev" or subscriptionName startswith "prd"
        | distinct subscriptionId, subscriptionName, appInsightsName, location
| project location

azureLogAnalytics.query:
let fcin = '$FullCustomerInstanceName';
print fcin
| extend SplitValues = split(fcin, ":")
| extend Region = tostring(SplitValues[1])
| extend Environment = tostring(SplitValues[0])
| extend AppInsightsInstance = strcat_delim("-", "ain", Environment, Region)
| project AppInsightsInstance

AppMetrics
| where AppRoleName contains "ConnectorReliabilityMonitor"
| distinct fcin = tostring(Properties.FullCustomerInstanceName)
| where isnotempty( fcin) and fcin != ":::"
| project fcin
| order by fcin asc

AppMetrics
| where TimeGenerated > ago(1d)
| where AppRoleName has "ConnectorReliabilityMonitor"
| extend FullCustomerInstanceName = tostring(Properties.FullCustomerInstanceName)
| where FullCustomerInstanceName == '$FullCustomerInstanceName'
| distinct ConnectorName = tostring(Properties.ConnectorName)
| where isnotempty( ConnectorName)
| project ConnectorName

AppMetrics
| where Name has 'EdgeMetrics'
| extend FullCustomerInstanceName = tostring(Properties.FullCustomerInstanceName)
| where FullCustomerInstanceName == '$FullCustomerInstanceName'
| distinct DeviceName = tostring(Properties.edge_device)
| order by DeviceName asc 
| project DeviceName
